item.title: The Talos Principle 2 DLC: All Isle Of The Blessed Blue Puzzle Solutions (Chapter 2)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Blue-1: The Smoothie Solution
  • Blue-2: The Ballet of the Bots
  • Blue-3: The Closing Conundrum
  • Blue-4: The Big Hassle
  • Blue-5: The Intruder
  • Blue-6: The Trident Enigma
  • Blue-7: The Twist and the Turn
  • Blue-8: The High Road

Like every other island on the Isle of the Blessed, the blue island in the second chapter of The Talos Principle 2 ’s DLC, Road to Elysium , presents players with eight challenging puzzles, each more intricate than the last. Mastering these puzzles is crucial to activating the Blue Lighthouse and advancing the storyline. For fans seeking a quick completion of the DLC, here is a comprehensive guide.

To help the beginner players of The Talos Principle 2 , we’ve piled up a quick glossary of the game’s terminologies:

  • RGB Converter : A device that can convert two laser colors. (It creates a Blue Laser if you give it Red and Green, Green if you give it Red and Blue, and Red if you give it Green and Blue.)
  • Gravshifter : A device that can create Gravity Beams on Magnetic Walls. Gravity Beams can move objects from one side of the map to the other.
  • Driller : You can use this device to poke holes in specific walls.
  • Jammer : An electromagnetic device that can disable certain puzzle elements such as Gates and Fans.
  • Activator : When connected to an energy source, the Activator can unlock gates.
  • Clone : An alternative body that you can take control of.
  • Generator : This is an RGB (Red, Green, or Blue) device that is the source of laser beams.
  • Receiver : A Receiver is a red, green, or blue device that’s activated when by a same-color laser beam.
  • Connector : You can use this device to move the laser beams or connect them to other devices. The Connector cannot generate a laser beam on its own.
  • Accumulator : Unlike a Connector, an Accumulator can generate laser beams once it’s charged by a Generator.
  • Pressure Plate : A device on the ground that activates puzzles mechanics when pressed.
  • Hexahedron : A cube-like object used to block laser beams, access higher grounds, or press the Pressure Plates.

Blue-1: The Smoothie Solution

  • Connect the first RGB Converter to the Green Receiver, Red Generator, and Blue Generator.
  • Link the second RGB Converter to the first RGB Converter, as well as the Red Generator and the Blue Receiver.
  • Use the third RGB Converter to connect from the Red Receiver to the other two RGB Converters.
  • Retrieve the fourth RGB Converter.
  • Adjust the connections of the first RGB Converter: Link it to the second RGB Converter, the Red Generator, and the Blue Generator.
  • Connect the third RGB Converter to the first RGB Converter, the Red Receiver, and the Blue Generator.
  • Take the fourth RGB Converter and connect it from the first (green) and third (red) RGB Converters to the Blue Receiver at the opposite end of the room.

Blue-2: The Ballet of the Bots

  • Assume control of the first Clone.
  • Teleport to the second Clone’s body.
  • Move to the opposite side of the room and return to your body through the left window.
  • Teleport again to the first Clone and position it in front of the leftmost corner window.
  • Return to your body.
  • From your body, teleport to the second Clone and have it stand on the Pressure Plate across the hallway.
  • Teleport into the first Clone and finally back into your body to complete the second puzzle of the blue island in The Talos Principle 2 ’s DLC.

Blue-3: The Closing Conundrum

  • Use the Driller to create a hole in the wall.
  • Place the Inverter in front of the hole to connect the Red Generator to the Blue Receiver.
  • Grab the Connector and link it from the Red Generator to the Red Receiver.
  • Retrieve the Inverter through the hole in the wall without disconnecting its current connections (use right-click to grab it).
  • Connect the Inverter to all three Blue Receivers, the Connector, and the Red Generator.
  • Retrieve the Driller from the other side and place it on the Pressure Plate to unlock the final gate.

Blue-4: The Big Hassle

  • Connect the first Activator to the Red Generator and position it next to the locked gate on the right.
  • Retrieve the Connector, link it to the Red Generator, and place it near the entrance to the puzzle area.
  • Take the Activator, connect it to the Red Generator and the Connector, and place it next to the other locked gate across the room.
  • Grab the Connector and link it to the Blue Generator.
  • Retrieve the second Activator and exit the room.
  • Place one of the Activators next to the locked gate on the right of the Red Generator, ensuring it remains connected to the Red Generator.
  • Take the other Activator and link it to the Connector attached to the Blue Generator, visible through the gap in the wall. Position this Activator behind the first Activator.
  • Finally, grab the first Activator and place it near the last gate blocking the Progress Wheel.
  • Quickly pass through the gate to complete the fourth puzzle in The Talos Principle 2 DLC. If not done in time, the Activator will deplete its energy, requiring you to repeat the last four steps.

Blue-5: The Intruder

  • Position the Connector on the Pressure Plate behind the wall, on the right flank of the room.
  • Replace the Connector with the Hexahedron.
  • Take the Connector, link it from the Red Receiver to the Red Generator, and place it over the other Pressure Plate near the puzzle room entrance.
  • Retrieve the Hexahedron and place it just behind the blue gate, to the right of the Connector.
  • Use the Gravshifter to create a Gravity Beam on the Magnetic Wall left of the Connector. Stand on the Pressure Plate next to the Hexahedron to pull it out of the locked area.
  • Take the Hexahedron and Gravshifter to the final puzzle area.
  • Position the Hexahedron over the Fan.
  • Now, retrieve the Connector. To avoid closing the gate by removing it from the Pressure Plate, walk on the Magnetic Wall until you are high enough to jump over the fences.
  • Link the Connector to the Blue Generator and the Blue Receiver and place it on the Hexahedron.
  • Use the Gravshifter to create a Gravity Beam on the wall across from the Fan and position the device itself over the Pressure Plate.

Blue-6: The Trident Enigma

  • Link the Activator to the Red Generator and place it directly in front to unlock both gates.
  • Grab the Hexahedron and position it over the Pressure Plate in the middle of the room, ensuring it remains connected to the Red Generator.
  • Use the Activator to open the gate blocking access to the Inverter.
  • Connect the Inverter from the Red Generator to the Blue Receiver located at the rear.
  • Utilize the Hexahedron to ascend the platform behind the Blue Receiver and retrieve the Connector.
  • Gather all the devices near the Red Generator in the main room, including the Hexahedron, Inverter, Activator, and newly acquired Connector.
  • Place the Inverter on the Pressure Plate.
  • Return the Activator to its original position to unlock the gates near the Red Generator.
  • Link the Connector from the Red Generator to the Red Receiver on the left.
  • Connect the Inverter to the Connector and the Blue Receiver at the back of the hallway.
  • Use the Hexahedron to climb the platform and retrieve the Jammer. Aim the Jammer at the locked gate ahead, then return to the main area.
  • Gather all three devices—the Inverter, Connector, and Hexahedron.
  • Connect the Inverter to the Blue Receiver across the room and position it over the Pressure Plate.
  • Move the Activator near the Inverter.
  • Link the Connector to the Red Receiver across the Pressure Plate, as well as to the Red Generator and Inverter.
  • Connect the Activator to the Connector and place it near the gate in front of the Pressure Plate.
  • Finally, use the Hexahedron to jump over the platform and activate the Progress Wheel.

Blue-7: The Twist and the Turn

  • Take the Connector and link it to both the Blue Generator and the Blue Receiver on the floating platform.
  • Grab the second Connector and link it from the Red Generator to the Red Receiver on the floating platform.
  • Connect the third Connector to the Green Generator and the Green Receiver located under the floating platform.
  • Grab the fourth Connector and link it from the Blue Receiver to the Connector attached to the Blue Generator. Position this Connector across from the Red Generator.
  • Return to the area of the Green Generator and block its Connector for a few seconds. This action rotates the floating platform, opening a gate.
  • Move the first Connector, set up in the first step, to the left of the Blue Generator.
  • Take the fourth Connector, link it to the Connector attached to the Red Generator, connect it to the Red Receiver on the floating platform, and place it to the right of the puzzle room’s entrance.
  • This sequence should unlock the final gate located at the back of the room.

Blue-8: The High Road

  • Place the Gravshifter on the Pressure Plate near the puzzle entrance.
  • Inside the unlocked area, swap the Hexahedron with the Connector.
  • Link the Connector to the Blue Generator and the Blue Receiver and position it over the other Pressure Plate in front of the Gravshifter.
  • Swap the Gravshifter with the Hexahedron.
  • Position the Hexahedron on the Magnetic Field behind the Blue Receiver.
  • Swap the Connector back with the Gravshifter.
  • Aim the Gravshifter at the Magnetic Ceiling directly above the Hexahedron to create a Gravity Beam that lifts it up.
  • Aim the Gravshifter at the other Magnetic Field across from the Hexahedron, located on the right flank of the room.
  • Place the Gravshifter on the Pressure Plate to exit this room.
  • Retrieve the other Gravshifter from the room directly below the Hexahedron.
  • Aim the second Gravshifter at the Magnetic Field above the puzzle room’s entrance (noting the Red Pressure Plate to its left).
  • Aim the other Gravshifter at the Magnetic Field in the leftmost corner of the room, the same area where you lifted the Hexahedron from the ground.
  • Once the Hexahedron is moved to the other side, aim one of the Gravshifters at the Pressure Plate on the ceiling, positioned above the swapping device.
  • Use the other Gravshifter to alter the direction of the Gravity Beam, aiming it back in the opposite direction of the Hexahedron’s current position.
  • Swap one of the Gravshifters with the Inverter from the other room.
  • Swap the other Gravshifter with the Connector.
  • Link the Connector to the Blue Generator and the Blue Receiver and place it over the Pressure Plate inside the room.
  • Connect the Inverter from the Blue Generator to the Red Receiver on the ceiling and place it on the Magnetic Field behind the Blue Receiver (the same platform used to lift the Hexahedron).
  • Swap the Connector with the Gravshifter, aiming the Gravshifter at the Magnetic Ceiling above the Inverter.
  • Finally, aim the Gravshifter at the Pressure Plate on the ceiling to the left of the Red Receiver, and place the Gravshifter itself over the Pressure Plate on the ground.
  • Once the Hexahedron presses the Pressure Plate on the ceiling, retrieve the final piece of the Progression Wheel to activate the Blue Lighthouse. This should conclude the puzzles in The Talos Principle 2 DLC’s Blue Island in chapter two.

item.title: The Talos Principle 2 DLC: All Isle of the Blessed Red Puzzle Solutions (Chapter 2)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Red-1: The Missing Element
  • Red-2: The Laser Circus
  • Red-3: The Bilateral Challenge
  • Red-4: The Euclidian Palette
  • Red-5: The Perpendicular Procedure
  • Red-6: The Celestial Beacon
  • Red-7: The Misalignment Syndrome
  • Red-8: The Riddle of the Citadel

The Red Island in the second chapter of The Talos Principle 2 ’s DLC features eight challenging puzzles. These puzzles must be solved to activate the first Lighthouse on the island. Below is a step-by-step guide to help you navigate and solve these riddles of Barzai, with visual hints provided for each puzzle.

Fortunately, most puzzles adhere to the same logic as those in the main campaign. However, in case you are a beginner player in The Talos Principle 2 , here’s a quick glossary to help you understand the game’s terminology:

  • RGB Converter : This device transforms two laser colors, producing a Blue Laser from Red and Green, Green from Red and Blue, and Red from Green and Blue.
  • Gravshifter : This tool generates Gravity Beams on Magnetic Walls, allowing the movement of objects across the map.
  • Driller : Use this device to create holes in specific walls.
  • Jammer : An electromagnetic device that disables Gates, Fans, and some other puzzle elements.
  • Activator : When linked to an energy source, it unlocks gates.
  • Clone : An alternate body you can control.
  • Generator : An RGB (Red, Green, or Blue) device serving as the laser beam source.
  • Receiver : Activated by a same-color laser beam, this device comes in red, green, or blue variants.
  • Connector : Use it to manipulate or link laser beams with other devices; it does not emit beams independently.
  • Accumulator : Unlike a Connector, it can generate laser beams once charged by a Generator.
  • Pressure Plate : Found on the ground, it activates puzzle mechanics when pressed.
  • Hexahedron : A cube-shaped object used to block laser beams, access elevated areas, or trigger Pressure Plates.

Red-1: The Missing Element

  • Grab the Activator, connect it to the Blue Generator, and place it next to the gate in front of the Pressure Plate.
  • Stand on the Pressure Plate for a few seconds.
  • Retrieve the Hexahedron (cube) from the other side of the unlocked gate.
  • Place the cube over the Fan behind the Pressure Plate.
  • Grab the Activator without disconnecting it from the Blue Generator.
  • Place the Activator on the cube and stand on the Pressure Plate for a few seconds. This will unlock the gate above the Fan and drop a Connector.
  • Connect the Connector to the Blue Generator and place it over the Pressure Plate.
  • Finally, grab the Activator, place it next to the gate blocking the portal, and link it to the Connector over the Pressure Plate.

Red-2: The Laser Circus

  • Place the Hexahedron on the Pressure Plate near the entrance.
  • Retrieve the RGB Converter from the unlocked room.
  • Move the Hexahedron to the Pressure Plate in front of the Red Generator.
  • Connect the RGB Converter from the Green Receiver to the Blue and Red Generators.
  • Retrieve the second RGB Converter from the unlocked room.
  • Connect the second RGB Converter to the Red Receiver using a link from the first RGB Converter and the Blue Generator.
  • Retrieve the third RGB Converter from the unlocked room.
  • Connect the third RGB Converter to the first and second RGB Converters, then link it to the Blue Receiver in front of the locked terminal.

Red-3: The Bilateral Challenge

  • Teleport into your Clone and stand on the Pressure Plate to unlock the gate.
  • Teleport back to your body, step onto the active Fan, and fly to push down the Hexahedron and Connector.
  • Take the Connector and link it to the Red Generator.
  • Place the Connector on the Red Pressure Plate where your Clone was standing.
  • Move your Clone near the Fan by switching between your body and the Clone. (You can only control your Clone if you can see it.)
  • While controlling your Clone, grab the second Connector and step onto the Fan.
  • Teleport back to your body and place the Hexahedron on the Fan.
  • Teleport to your Clone and link the Red Receiver to the Connector while floating in the air.
  • Finally, place the Connector on the Hexahedron and teleport back to your body to complete the puzzle.

Red-4: The Euclidian Palette

  • Take the first Connector and link it to the Green Generator and the wall-mounted RGB Converter on the right side of the room.
  • Grab the Gravshifter and create a Gravity Beam on the wall to the left of the RGB Converter.
  • Once the RGB Converter is moved to the other side, use the Gravshifter again to create a Gravity Beam on the wall behind the Green Generator.
  • Grab the second Connector and link it to the two Blue Receivers, the Blue Generator, and the RGB Converter.
  • Disconnect the first Connector and link it to the Red Receiver and the RGB Converter on the wall.
  • Use the Gravshifter to move the RGB Converter back to its original position on the right side of the room.
  • This will unlock the Progress Wheel and complete the fourth puzzle of the second chapter in The Talos Principle 2 ’s DLC.

Red-5: The Perpendicular Procedure

  • Jump onto the magnetic wall on the left to retrieve the Connector.
  • Carry the Connector to the other magnetic wall where the Blue Receiver is visible.
  • Connect the Connector to the Blue Generator and Blue Receiver, placing it under the leftmost platform, left of the Blue Receiver.
  • Pass through the unlocked gate and retrieve the Driller hanging from the ceiling.
  • Use the Driller to create a hole in the wall behind the Connector.
  • Take the Hexahedron and push it through the hole onto the Red Pressure Plate.
  • Grab the Driller and place it on the second Pressure Plate next to the Hexahedron, ensuring it faces the same wall to maintain the hole behind the Hexahedron.
  • Finally, retrieve the Connector from the other side of the hole and connect it to the Red Generator and Red Receiver located just above the Progress Wheel.

Red-6: The Celestial Beacon

  • Jam the first gate using the Jammer. (Place the Jammer next to the metal fences left of the gate.)
  • Take the Inverter and create a line from the Blue Generator to the Red Receiver.
  • Retrieve the Connector from the unlocked area.
  • Swap the Connector with the Hexahedron.
  • Place the Hexahedron near the metal fences, stand on it, and take the Jammer.
  • Use the Jammer to unlock the same gate from this side of the room.
  • Take the Inverter and connect it from the Blue Generator to the Connector behind the Red Receiver on the wall. After linking the Inverter, place it in the main room near the puzzle entrance, ensuring its laser beams can pass through the metal fences to the right of the first gate.
  • Swap the Hexahedron with the Connector.
  • Create a connection between the Red Receiver, the Red Connector on the wall, and the Connector in your hand.
  • Grab the Jammer and use it to deactivate the gate controlled by the Red Receiver from the other side.
  • Now, bring the Connector with you to the final area of the puzzle.
  • Rotate the Jammer to deactivate the gate at the end of the puzzle room.
  • Link the Connector to the Red Connector on the wall and the Red Receiver near the Progress Wheel.
  • Finally, use the Jammer to deactivate the last gate and complete the puzzle.

Red-7: The Misalignment Syndrome

  • Take the Driller and make a hole in the wall of the room with a Pressure Plate and a Connector. (Place the Driller next to the purple gate.)
  • Grab the Connector in this room and position it over the Pressure Plate.
  • Remove the Fan from the middle of the room and toss it into the previous room through the hole in the wall.
  • Replace the Fan with the Connector.
  • Push the Connector out of the room through the same hole in the wall.
  • Use the Driller to create a hole in the wall of the adjacent room where the second Driller and Hexahedron are located.
  • Link the Green Generator and the Green Receiver in this room using the Connector.
  • Push the Connector into the room through the hole to unlock the gate.
  • Retrieve the Driller and Cube from this room, then bring the Connector back through the hole in the wall.
  • Use the second Driller to make a hole in the same wall as in the first step.
  • Push the other Driller into this room through the newly created hole.
  • Replace the Fan on the Pressure Plate with the Driller. Shoot the Fan out of the room through the hole.
  • Reinstall the Fan into its original position.
  • Place the Hexahedron on the Fan.
  • Create a line between the Green Generator and the Green Receiver above the Progress Wheel using the Connector.
  • Position the Connector over the Hexahedron.
  • Retrieve the Driller outside the locked room. Place it on the Pressure Plate near the Fan, aiming at the top of the wall where you made the first hole.
  • Finally, with the other Driller from the locked room, create a hole in the wall obstructing the Green Laser beam, aiming through the initial hole you made.

Red-8: The Riddle of the Citadel

  • Enter the room with an active Fan and use its stream to fly to the other side.
  • Retrieve the Inverter and jump down.
  • Connect the Inverter to the Blue Generator near the Pressure Plate and the Red Receiver near the Fan.
  • Retrieve the Connector and link it to the other Red Receiver across the room from the Fan.
  • Grab the Inverter and connect it from the Blue Generator to the Connector you just placed.
  • Stand on the Pressure Plate for a few seconds to drop a Hexahedron from one of the platforms.
  • Grab the Inverter, connect it to the Red Generator, and position it in front of the platform directly across from the Red Generator.
  • Take the Hexahedron and place it next to the Inverter.
  • Use the Connector to create a line from the Inverter to the Blue Receiver on top of the tall platform in the middle of the room.
  • This action lowers the platform like an elevator. Place the Hexahedron on the platform and, while standing on it, grab the Inverter to activate the platform again.
  • Once the elevator reaches the top, grab the Inverter, create a line between the Red Generator and the Blue Receiver across from it, and place the Inverter on the Hexahedron.
  • Jump down to interact with the Progress Wheel and complete the puzzle.

item.title: Roblox: Untitled Boxing Game Codes (June 2024)
item.description:
Untitled Boxing Game is still very popular among Roblox players, so the developers are working hard to release regular updates. They often add codes to the game when they do so, all of which can be found below. In addition to Untitled Boxing Game codes, Roblox players can find more information about the game here.

Updated June 15, 2024, by Artur Novichenko: We have found a new Untitled Boxing Game code for you. This code offers 5 spins, so don't forget to redeem it and other active codes.

How to Redeem Codes in Untitled Boxing Game

If players want to get these valuable rewards but don't know how, then this guide will help. Since it is similar to most other Roblox games, the process is simple, so players need not spend too much time on it. Everything that needs to be done is described in the step-by-step instructions below. If a particular code is not redeemable, it is likely because it has expired. In that case, users can try other codes:

  • To get the reward, it is necessary to launch an Untitled Boxing Game .
  • After that, players will find the Codes button on the screen, located on the left in the middle of the screen.
  • Then, a field will appear in which it will be necessary to enter or paste the above codes.
  • And finally, to enter the code, click or tap the Redeem button.

Untitled Boxing Game Tips and Tricks

Below, players will find tips and tricks for Untitled Boxing Game :

  • Dodge right before the attack.
  • Use the ultimate strike when breaking the enemy's shield to increase the chances of hitting.
  • Use the codes mentioned above to get spins and choose a fight style.
  • Adjust tactics for the specific fight style selected.
  • Use strong punches to break the shield.

The Best Roblox Fighting Games Like Untitled Boxing Game

In case players want to enjoy some other great fighting games on Roblox , they can find a list of the best games, like Untitled Boxing Game, below:

  • Muscle Legends
  • Ninja Legends
  • Rogue Demon
  • Blox Fruits
  • Dragon Blox

About the Untitled Boxing Game Developer

Untitled Boxing Game was developed by a single developer called Drowningsome. But so far, this is the only game he has created, so fans are waiting for new projects.

item.title: Roblox: Slap Battles Codes (June 2024)
item.description:
Roblox offers players a wide variety of different games that often bring with them a ton of fun, and Slap Battles is no exception. Here, you need to slap other players using different gloves with unique abilities. In Slap Battles , you need to slap as many people as possible in different game modes to unlock new gloves. If you want to progress faster, we've prepared a list of all of the active Slap Battles codes.

Updated June 15, 2024, by Artur Novichenko: Unfortunately, there are no new codes for Slap Battles at this time. We will update this guide as soon as new ones are released so that you can get all the freebies as soon as possible.

All Slap Battles Codes

Nothing can be more satisfying than joining the battle with new gloves. The codes we offer can be redeemed for Slaps, which in turn can be used to purchase different gloves with unique abilities. So, don't hesitate and redeem the codes for Slap Battles :

Working Slap Battles Codes (June 2024)

  • Beginner - Redeem this code for 75 Slaps

Expired Slap Battles Codes (June 2024)

  • LoneOrange
  • HappyNewYear
  • ArcWasHere
  • OneMillionLikes
  • BobaWasHere

How to Redeem Codes in Slap Battles

If you have played other Roblox games, then the process of redeeming codes in Slap Battles should be familiar to you, so you won't have any trouble dealing with it. You can redeem the codes as soon as you start the game, which will help you get a great glove right from the beginning. If you don't know how to redeem codes in Slap Battles yet, follow the guide below:

  • Launch Roblox .
  • Go to Slap Battles experience.
  • Launch the game.
  • Once in the game world, click on the Twitter bird on the left side of the screen.
  • When you are in the code redemption menu, you need to verify.
  • Once you have verified, enter your code.
  • Click Redeem.
  • Enjoy.

If your code doesn't work, try to copy it from the list above to avoid misspellings. Also, make sure that you have not redeemed this code before because all codes can only be used once. It's worth noting that each code has its own expiration date, so be sure to redeem it before the developers deactivate it.

How to Get More Slap Battles Codes

If you want to get more codes for Slap Battles , you can follow the developers' official social media accounts. Usually, they release new codes on their pages during holidays, updates, or some events. Here are some accounts you may want to follow:

  • Discord
  • Roblox Group
  • Twitter (X)

Also, we update this article regularly, so it’s a good idea to bookmark this page and check back here from time to time.

Quick Links

  • All King Legacy Codes
  • How to Redeem Codes in King Legacy
  • King Legacy Tips and Tricks
  • Best Anime Roblox Games Like King Legacy
  • About the King Legacy Developers

The developers of King Legacy are constantly updating the game and providing many new codes. These codes have a significant impact on the experience, especially in the early stages of the game, as they offer a bunch of freebies, including gems, boosts, and cash. Roblox players can scroll down to see the complete list of King Legacy codes, as well as a guide to redeeming them, a list of other games like King Legacy , and information about the game's developers.

Updated June 15, 2024, by Artur Novichenko: The developers of King Legacy periodically release new codes, but none have been introduced since the last update. However, the good news is that the active active codes still work and give valuable rewards, so if you haven't redeemed them yet, now is the time.

How to Redeem Codes in King Legacy

To redeem codes in Roblox: King Legacy , players must follow a few quick steps. To obtain some of the latest supplies from codes, they should input them correctly by copying and pasting the list provided. If a code doesn't work, they should double-check that the spelling is correct. If it still doesn't work, it has likely been redeemed or is no longer available.

  1. Launch King Legacy
  2. Click on the Settings button in the drop-down menu
  3. In the Settings window, click inside the Enter Code box and paste the code
  4. Click Enter to complete the process

King Legacy Tips and Tricks

To begin with, it is necessary to understand that players who want to achieve success must complete many quests. Players can find them in the city. A very important aspect of the game is the selection of enemies by level. Initially, it will be difficult for players to deal with enemies of a higher level, so choose carefully. Using additional skills such as Smash is also very important for victory.

Best Anime Roblox Games Like King Legacy

With thousands of Roblox games available, players often search for something new. The reason for this is that all games get dull over time, and this section aims to help players if and when this occurs. Below, they will find a list of the best Roblox games, like King Legacy :

  • Project Slayers
  • Anime Adventures
  • Shindo Life
  • Ro Ghoul
  • Zo Samurai

About the King Legacy Developers

King Legacy was created by a group of developers called Venture Lagoons. They are pretty popular, and their group on the Roblox website currently has 621K members. Unfortunately, King Legacy is the only game from these developers that is so popular.
